sentence.text: Of the 2 204 genes that were mutated, cellular response to DNA damage stimulus, detection of muscle stretch, TP53, KRAS, OBSCN, SOX9, cell adhesion, negative regulation of inflammatory response to wounding, regulation of the force of heart contraction, and biological_process were consistent with genes being an early driver of carcinogenesis, in that they were mutated in multiple adenomas and multiple carcinomas.

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
negative regulation of inflammatory response to wounding
regulation of the force of heart contraction

sentence.text: Thirty-eight genes were sequenced in a larger independent negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated of 148 carcinoma/normal tissue pairs to obtain more precise mutation frequencies.

Eight of the genes, cellular response to DNA damage stimulus, TP53, protein phosphorylation, regulation of dendrite development, receptor-mediated endocytosis, detection of calcium ion, regulation of cytokinesis, and stimulatory C-type lectin receptor signaling pathway, contained mutations in AAAA20% of the carcinomas.

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
stimulatory C-type lectin receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Most of the genes that are commonly associated with colon cancer, including cellular response to DNA damage stimulus, TP53, and positive regulation of protein phosphorylation, were all classified as being early driver genes being mutated in both adenomas and carcinomas.

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus

sentence.text: Of the 2 204 genes that were mutated, APC, TTN, TP53, positive regulation of protein phosphorylation, protein localization to M-band, SOX9, PCDH17, SIGLEC10, MYH6, and BRD9 were consistent with genes being an early driver of carcinogenesis, in that they were mutated in multiple adenomas and multiple carcinomas.
